snippet: From Edward J. Snowden’s friends and his own voluminous Web postings emerges a portrait of a talented young man who did not finish high school but bragged online that employers “fight over me.”
abstract: Edward J Snowden's friends and his own Web postings paint portrait of talented young man who was shaped by rebellious culture; Snowden's leaking of classified information reflected his admiration for other whistle-blowers, and may have also reflected his own considerable ambition.

byline.original: By JOHN M. BRODER and SCOTT SHANE
byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Ian Lovett from Waipahu, Hawaii; Theo Emery from Ellicott City, Md.; and Steve Lohr and Richard A. Oppel Jr. from New York. Kitty Bennett contributed research.

lead_paragraph: From Edward J. Snowden’s friends and his own voluminous Web postings emerges a portrait of a talented young man who did not finish high school but bragged online that employers “fight over me.”

headline.main: For Snowden, a Life of Ambition, Despite the Drifting
headline.print_headline: A Life of Ambition, Despite the Drifting
